column1: boom! What a start! The crowd has lost it. Overpitched and wide outside off. Zaman springs into it with his hands stretched and crashes it past mid-off
length on off stump, dabbed to third man's left
length on leg stump, nudged to fine leg's left
short and just outside off, cut straight to cover point

misfield from short fine and deep square hares to the left as if the reputation of the tournament itself is in his hands. Looks like Salt out there, with a slide to his left and push back in. Waqas with the misfield as Zaman flicked this straight to him from a good length
short and up the ribs. Can't get bat on the flick
length and pushed across off stump, tapped to extra cover
overpitched outside off, drilled firmly towards mid-off where Rizwan gets down with the barrier to field and gets hit on the soft part of his knee. He's hobbling off now
length and turning into him as he back away to make room. Forced to push it back to the bowler
full on middle stump, driven with the turn to long-on
full and fired into the pads, allows it to come on and flicks to deep square's right
length on leg stump, flicked through midwicket off the front foot
full on leg stump, flicked to midwicket
length outside off. Looks to slap it through the covers, but it comes back down the pitch off the toe-end
length ball pushed across the off stump, sliced on the up, straight to point
slapped over mid-off. Length outside off, skids on nicely and there's a lot of room. Just hits through the line with an angled bat
length outside off, chopped down to third man
outside edge short of the keeper. Slower ball from the bowler. Good length and just outside off. Looks to poke at it on the front foot
length on leg stump, flicked straight to midwicket
full on middle stump, steps out and yorks himself. Taps it back towards the bowler
smoked it! Full on middle stump. Doesn't step out this time. Gets into the leg side to make room and a clean swing on the slog sweep
beaten in flight but big swing again. Length on middle stump, loses his shape as he slugs this off the inside part of the bat. No one at the midwicket fence
yorker at leg stump, flicked to long-on's left
length and slanting into him as he backs away into the leg side. He keeps going and swings through the line to get this wide of long-on
dropped! Oh Samit. Simple, straightforward, looping at his right knee. Pops out. Full on off stump, mistimed drive back at him
yorker length at leg stump, flicked to fine leg
length on leg stump, flicked to deep square
length and cramping him at leg stump as he stays tall to keep the room. Pokes it down the pitch
can't cramp him this time. Full and into his body as he's moving down leg. But the fuller length allows for a flick and this races through midwicket
yorker. Nicely executed. Straight at the front toe and he can't do more than jam this out
length on middle stump, behind the line to try and flick, but closes the face too early. Back to the bowler off the leading edge
length outside off, jabbed to backward point
short of a length on leg stump, whipped to deep midwicket off the back foot
length ball down leg side. Looks to pick this behind square leg but can't connect on it. Deflected off the keeper
length on the stumps, punched to long-on
huge! Keeps backing away into the leg side but is still incredibly hard to stop. Length on middle stump and he clubs it high over long-on to bring up the fifty stand
low full toss on leg stump, clipped to deep midwicket
length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket's right
bouncer at an off stump line, ducks under it
short ball just outside off, looks to pull, is too late on it. It comes off the inside half to midwicket
short of a length just outside off, stays leg side of it and runs it to third man
short at middle stump, mistimed pull out to deep midwicket
blazes this past point! What a hit. Short of a length outside off and he stays low as he gets his hands through the line of this
length outside off, opens the face and runs this straight to backward point
overpithched outside off, driven straight to extra cover
short and just outside off, cut to sweeper's right and Rizwan puts in a slide there and comes close to stepping on the padding. Safe in the end
length on leg stump, turned into the square leg region off the inside edge

off the bottom but clears the boundary! Boundaries brought in a long way and Shadab will bear the penalty on that. Length ball wide outside off, reaches with the slog sweep as it turns away from him and gets it over the bowler and past the straight fielders
short and wide outside off, chopped to sweeper cover
length on leg stump, pushed into the midwicket region with soft hands
length on leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket's left
length on leg stump, lifted on the up to long-on
shot. But sweeper there. Short of a length just outside off and a cracking punch on the rise
short and wide outside off, pulls off the inside half to long-on
short ball jumps up from off stump. He's cramped on the pull and it lands on the pitch
pumped! Overpitched on off stump, doesn't even bother putting the front foot out for this. Stays put and slams it past the bowler
length ball outside off. Skips into the leg side to make some extra room and scythes this behind point with an open face
length ball into the pads. Stays tall and dabs it off the inside half. Short fine dives to the left but can only parry it into the boundary
short of a length on off, whipped to deep square. Fifty for Fakhar Zaman. His 11th in the format
short and skidding through quickly outside off. Stabs at it and is beaten
short of a length outside off, whipped to deep midwicket off the back foot
short and just outside off, cut straight to point...whose unnecessary gives them a single at deep square
short of a length on middle stump, backs away and pulls to deep midwicket
short ball in the corridor. Looks like a slower one. He slashes on top of it and is beaten on the under-edge
doesn't miss this! Short and up at his chest. Gets on his back toe and whips to deep square's right. A sliding stop there from Delport

review for catch behind by Sohail. He was looking to play the hook and was cramped. Looked like it came off the helmet as he looked to back down the leg side and hit that...was there an edge before that though? Yes there was! He is gone. As is the review. Replays confirm the right decision was made. A good innings from Sohail nonetheless, he's given Lahore a superb start to the season
it's a slower short ball, which he picks up like a love note wafting into his path, and taps it to deep third man
tries to whip it over square leg with the ball pitching on a length on leg stump. Will be annoyed he didn't send the people in the stands scurrying

beats him! Many reckon he's one of the best to ever play the game but here he's done in like a rookie. Shadab gets dip. He gets turn. He has AB reaching in front of his body, panicked into playing against the turn, and is lucky not to get out
makes room outside leg and cracks a googly to deep cover point
just stays within the offside tram lines as Shadab tries to keep away from Fakhar's bat-swing
goes off the toe-end as Shadab keeps bowling wide outside off and Fakhar keeps trying to swing across the line
pushes it through - the one that spins into AB again - and he doesn't quite make contact with the flick
sets up in a crouch to deal with a short ball, but he's unable to clear the boundary. Only a single to long-on
lashes it to the point boundary! All he needs is pace on the ball and he perks right up. Course this is short and wide so really he had to put it away, if only to prove he's not an imposter
heaves it to the square leg boundary! Stands still, winds up, and de-ruddy-well-livers. Too short from Talat again
pitches it a little further up, but at his pace, de Villiers is lining him up like those carnival shooting games. BANG! Slog to deep square leg again

launches it over extra cover! He's on the front foot. He sees room to free the arms. He gets a little taller because there's a touch more bounce than he likes. Mid-off is up. And he just lifts it over the man
steps away from his crease, Talat follows him and as a result, the pull shot only results in a single to deep midwicket
bye-bye baby! It's length again. Straight into the merciless golf swing - he's had plenty of time to practice those after retirement. Yo fans at midwicket, pick it up and toss it back!
straight down the ground! And it's maaaaasssssive! Shadab errs by looping the ball a little too much and Fakhar winds up and wallops it over the leggie's head
fires it in flat and quick, Fakhar whisks it to deep midwicket
backs away and lofts the full delivery outside off over the covers but there's protection out there
goes round the stumps and may have sneaked in the offbreak! Lands on a length, Fakhar goes for the sweep, but misses

taken at point! Excellent bowling from Shadab! He sees Fakhar's petulant stray down the track. Throws it wide of the left-hander's reach, who still looks to drag it from way outside off stump into the leg side, and pays for the mistake. Miscue lobs up and lands in a diving Rizwan's hands
pushes it through on off stump, de Villiers works it to long-on
full and wide outside off, de Villiers rather mercifully taps it to cover
shortish and outside off, chops it to point. Looks like Islamabad are working on the principle of denying AB any pace on the ball
goes back and flicks the length ball from round the stumps to deep midwicket
straying onto the pads and AB whips it behind square leg
turns the pitched-up delivery through midwicket
looks like the legcutter, but it doesn't even pretend to turn. AB taps it down to long-on
goes for the cut but there's not enough room for it and so he chops it into the covers
slower ball, outside off, with no room, leaving Devcich with little choice but to dab through point

taken at long-off! Brilliant effort on the boundary, moving back, leaping up over his left shoulder, both hands high up and a split second later, the ball sticks in them. Sussex's Phillip Salt has just broken the internet. Or well, close enough. And AB, having looked in good touch, is deceived by a slower ball, his loft intended to carry over the boundary not quite reaching its destination
nudges a back of a length delivery through midwicket
fullish on off stump, Taylor blocks behind point
another slower ball, and Devcich, having got into position to pull it too early, has to adjust his bat swing and settle for a single to square leg
full on middle, drums it down the ground, and Asif Ali is at long-on, diving full-length to his right and stopping the boundary
hares down the track, putting his own pace if the bowler doesn't give him any, but yet he ends up reaching out for the ball and miscuing it to deep midwicket
looks for the blockhole and is rewarded with an inside edge, which he has to watch trickle down to long leg and become runs against his name. Ugh, cruel game
flicks a full delivery on middle to long-on
lofts the full ball on the stumps to long-on

premeditates a sweep, looking to help the ball away to fine leg, but Delport benefits by keeping a wicket-to-wicket line with his change of pace deliveries and the little legbreak pins Taylor in front
the hop skip and jump down the track just isn't working. Maqsood spots it, sneaks in a bouncer and secures a top-edged swipe to long leg
full and outside off, he steers it to deep third man
slogs a length ball outside off to deep midwicket

holds his shape so well! It's a short ball angled across him and he waits just that little bit longer - he needs to on a slow pitch - and then cracks it to the right of point and to the left of the sweeper. Brilliant batting
a little cut off the pitch ruins Brathwaite's launch down the ground. The offcutter working its magic
nails the wide yorker, which Brathwaite slices to deep third man
starts with a wide yorker that Brathwaite isn't able to touch.

premeditates the scoop aaaaaand it's caught by a backtracking square leg. Out to a full toss. One that gives him plenty of room to free the hands and heft it over the covers. But having committed to playing on the leg side, he ends up top-edging to Talat

dropped by Samit running back at fine leg. He does well to track the ball over his shoulder, gets both hands to it, but in the end it pops out. Unfortunate for Faheem, whose variations have been on point tonight. This bit of shenanigans is the result of a slower bouncer which Devcich doesn't quite pick up properly and so miscues his pull
whips it to the square leg boundary. Majestic batting from the Lahore captain, stepping into the middle and sending his first ball into the gap and away for four

is Devcich run-out?. Yep. He's called through for a leg bye after Hafeez misses a pull shot and gets struck somewhere near the armpit but is a bit slow to respond and even a full length dive can't save him from Ashraf's direct hit
another slower short ball, another batsman through with the pull shot too early, another hit on the body. Except there's no run-out.
takes on the short ball and dumps it into the stands behind deep midwicket. Monster hit
backs away and pulls the short ball to long-on
keeps his balance and swings the back of a length delivery out to deep midwicket

nicely done - both from the bowler and then from Ronchi, underarming the ball at the stumps and breaking them. It's funny really. Yasir's barely moved from his position as the batsman but replays shows Hafeez is already there, within handshaking distance, and as a result of that, he's the one that's out. The batsmen didn't cross so Yasir has to go
swings the back of a length ball out to deep midwicket
full, straight, Afridi plays all around it and is out lbw. Just too quick for him. But wait, the replay seems to suggest he may have been struck outside the line of off stump
wide of mid-on and four straight away! Length ball with some late swing back in. Cramped a touch but he goes through and lifts it over the circle

superb fielding! To start with, anyway. Shoaib flying to his right to stop at cover. On on replay that's a dropped catch as well, but he's done stunningly to even get a hand on this. Length outside off, slapped uppishly to his right. He gets a hand on it and throws at the non-striker's end where they get an overthrow
length on off stump, stays still in the crease and uses his hands to drag this over the bowler
length on leg stump, whipped to fine leg
oh nicely timed, but straight to extra cover. Length and pushed across off stump. Slams on the rise with bent knees
see ya! What a shot! Runs down the pitch at an inswinger that is down leg side. Doesn't lean in - just trusts the bounce and whips the wrists to send this over the midwicket boundary
back of a length and outside off, he fishes for it and nothing comes up
goes searching for the ball outside off with a cut shot, but can't reach it
punches the shortish delivery to cover
drives down the ground, softly enough to pinch a single to mid-off
he's hit on the thigh as he tries to pull a shortish delivery away. And since he's also out of his crease as well, he has to put the pain behind him and rush back to safety

appeal for lbw, with Ronchi not quite liking the ball on the in-between length, where he can't pull it, nor drive it. And since there's no room either all he can do is flap across the line and get hit on the pad
ramps it to the third man boundary. Splendid batting as he picks up the short ball early, sways his body out of the way and then presents the bat up for it to ping off

flays it through point! The angle from round the wicket doesn't help Afridi one bit. He still offers room - well room enough for Ronchi who takes guard on leg stump to open up the off side - and he hits through the line like a boss
yorker on middle, Ronchi just about gets the bat down in time and finds a single at square leg. Outstanding response from young Afridi
nudges a back of a length delivery off his pads to short fine leg
tries an on-the-up drive but he's beaten all ends up by an offcutter. Lucky it's just a shade outside the line of the stumps
another pin-point yorker, which Ronchi is somehow able to spirit away to long-on. Excellent finish to the over. Only three runs after the first couple of balls were walloped for fours
comes down the track and pummels the short ball to the square leg boundary. The new ball is the best time to score runs on this pitch and Ronchi's certainly not holding back
full on middle, Ronchi swings hard, but it bounces off his pads to square leg
backs away and carves the short and wide delivery to the point boundary. Outrageous timing
slower ball but it sits up to be lofted over long-on. Too full. In the slot. Dispatched
pulls his length back, gets a little more pace into it as well, and with very little room on hand, Rizwan can only find mid-on
swings the short ball out to midwicket
hangs back to the short ball and cuts it strongly to the right of point. Diving stop from Sohail there keeps it to a single
whips a quick and flat delivery to square leg
punches the pushed-through delivery outside off to mid-off
wicket-to-wicket and Ronchi, even as he tries to make room, can only push it to cover
pulls the quick and short delivery on middle to deep midwicket
full and outside off, drives to mid-off
taken at mid-off! This length ball holds its line in the corridor as Rizwan looks to club into the leg side. Comes off the outside part of the bat and hangs up for Hafeez to take that
two in two! Terrible ball, but Ronchi has managed to drag it straight to short fine. Short ball down leg side, there for the pull. He takes it on but can't get it over the fielder
past the outside edge. Length ball pushed wide outside off, slashes at it and is beaten
length on off stump, defended to point off the back foot
through the covers. Full ball just outside off, gets his weight into this shot and opens the face late to bisect cover point and extra

straight to extra cover this time! Oh dear. That is ordinary batting throughout this over. Length ball outside off, chucks his bat at this without too much feet. Slightly away from the body, no attempt to keep this down. Ends up slicing a simple catch
length at off stump, punched to long-off
length on middle stump, looks to flick, closes the face too early. Leading edge to short third
full on leg stump, flicked to deep square
length on leg stump, driven to long-on
length at off stump, punched to long-off
short of a length just outside off, chopped to point
length on leg stump, flicked to short fine
full and down leg side, beaten on the sweep
length on middle, steps out and flicks onto his pad off the inside edge
length and flat at off stump, hurried sweep to deep square off the inside half
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length outside off, driven on the up to long-off
short of a length outside off, punched to extra cover's right
length on off stump, reverse sweep nailed. But straight to point

missed run-out chance because of a poor throw from AB. That's rare. Length at off stump, steps out and taps to extra cover's left. AB gets to the ball and Delport isn't even halfway up to the striker's end. But the throw is woefully wide
short of a length on middle, mistimed pull to deep midwicket
length on middle, punched to deep midwicket with the angle
length on midde, looks to tap through the off side, gets an inside edge to midwicket
length on middle, tapped to long-on's left
short and just outside off. Angling away. Swishes at this and is beaten. 138kph says the gun. Hayden on commentary reckons that was much faster
short of a length and skidding on at off stump. Looks to pull, gets it off the inside half to long-on's left. 138kph again
length on leg stump, looks to flick, gets it off the inside edge to deep midwicket
slower short ball, wide outside off. Left alone
short of a length outside off, skids on as he pulls off the toe-end to long-on. 137kph
short of a length just outside off, stays leg side of it and dabs to third man
full on off stump, backs away and drills it to long-off
length on off stump, driven back to the bowler
short of a length just outside off, punched to extra cover's right
nicely put away! Short of a length and skidding in at middle. Gets on the back foot and is hurried, but he swivels and powers this pull over the midwicket boundary
wow! Stunning hit. Length outside off, steps out and makes room before whipping hard at this and going inside-out, along the floor to the extra cover boundary
length on middle, whipped to deep midwicket with the angle
length on leg, driven to long-on
full outside off, makes room and drives to extra cover
falls short of deep midwicket. Length and skidding through at leg stump. Pulls off the toe-end
beamer! Flying wide of the batsman on the off side. Followed up with an apology. Free hit coming up
full and just outside off. Late on the drive. Ends up slicing it to sweeper cover
length down leg side. Looks to flick, cops it on the front pad
full and just outside off. Shuffles and drives on the rise. Can't get it past AB at mid-off. A dive to the left from him
over fine leg. Just helped along with the pace. Short and up at middle stump. Swipes from underneath this and is not in control, but it's just enough bat to clear the boundary
full on middle stump, gets down and paddles to short fine
full on off stump, gets to the pitch and bludgeons it straight back at his partner who has to duck quickly
length and down leg side, can't get bat on the sweep
length on leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
length on middle stump, gets under it and swipes it high! Long long way over deep midwicket! Yasir pushing it flat and on a good length. Perfect timing on the slog sweep
short of a length outside off, punched to extra cover
short of a length on leg stump, steps out and flicks to deep midwicket

he's got a fourth! Can you believe it?! Four wickets in seven balls, incredible. And what a time to pick this one up too. Delport had just begun getting it right. Length ball at off stump, looks to drill it straight. Bat turns in his hand and it is high and lobbed for extra cover, who jogs to the right and holds on. On a hat-trick again.
just past point! So close. Short and wide outside off, throws his hands at this and gets it to point's right. His one-handed leap doesn't get him there
length on middle, tapped to long-on off the front foot
short of a length on off stump, defended into the off side
short of a length just outside off, inside edge onto pad rolls through to the keeper
length ball down leg side, looks to sweep, gets it off the glove to the keeper's right
pushed full and very wide outside off, can't get bat to that
drilled wide of mid-off. Good batting. Knew this was going across him, so he stepped into the off side and waited. He got the length ball and he got his hands through it
length on leg stump, flicked to short fine's right
short of a length on leg stump, nudged through square leg off the back foot

straight to short fine! Talat does himself in over here. Moved too early for the attempted ramp. Bowler saw him and got a short slower ball in. It was rising on him by the end and there was no pace on it. Lobbed straight to that fielder
short of a length just outside off, chopped to point
spanked! Clean hitting. Short ball up at off stump. Gets under this and lifts it over deep midwicket who is pedaling backwards
short and wide outside off, cut straight to sweeper cover
reverse sweep connected perfectly. Length on off stump, gets down quickly and gets really low to bisect point and short third
length on middle, tapped to deep midwicket off the back foot
short of a length just outside off, punched to sweeper cover
and another! Length and skidding across, quick. Easy pickings at that pace. Reverse-whip, just past short third
full outside off, poked into the off side
poor start. Knee height full toss just outside off, shuffles and hammers it over the bowler. Mid-off is in too
past the outside edge. Offcutter in the corridor, cutting away from a length. Looks to nudge it through the off side but can't get bat on it
to the long leg boundary. Short ball at off. Shuffles, uses the pace and the angle into him to lift this behind square
yorker just outside off, past the outside edge as he looks to jam it to third man
short of a length on middle stump, mistimed uppish pull to midwicket
inswinging yorker at leg stump. Can't do more with that than hitting it onto his own boot

almost gets the fifth! But Devcich can't hold on with a sensational effort at long-off. Offcutter, at a length outside off. Slammed on the up, flat. Devcich leaps and parries it over the rope. Tries to drag it back into play but he can't quite manage it
pummeled over midwicket! Short of a length, slower ball at leg stump. Behind the line and smash! Simple as it gets
slower ball at a length just outside off. Misses on the pull this time
yorker tailing away outside off. Can't get bat on this
full and very wide. Can't keep up the streak. No chance that batsman can hit this
short of a length on leg stump, flicks to short fine's left. Shaheen dives and misses. And the clutches his left bicep
slower short ball outside off, looks to pull, inside edge onto body and trickles into the leg side
full outside off, driven straight to extra cover
This is sweetly struck. Overpitched just outside off, drilled straight past his feet. Long-off had to be quick to his right
full on middle stump, driven to long-on
full and down leg side, lets it pass

just clears the boundary at long-on. Slower ball at a good length, outside off. Full swing of the bat and not completely in control of the timing, but there was enough power to clear the fence despite the extra elevation
length outside off, drilled to long-off's left
low full toss at leg stump, looks to drive straight, gets it to fine leg off the inside edge
length ball fired at a length on middle stump. Drives to mid-off's left. AB dives to stop
first tier over the midwicket boundary to finish! Length ball fired at middle, backs away and clears the boundary easily with a pull
